document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the genus Sirthenea (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae) of the Old World

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Rasahus flavipes
Stål, 1855 : 187
. Syntype (s): Brasilia [= Brazil ] [in error, probably Philippines ].

Rasahus cumingi
Dohrn, 1860 : 407
. Syntype (s): Ceylon [= Sri Lanka ]. Synonymized by
Distant (1902: 286)
.

Rasahus apicalis
Signoret, 1862 : 125
. Syntype (s): Cochinchina [= Vietnam ]; NHMW. Synonimized by
Stål (1866: 252)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pirates flavipes : Walker (1873: 100, 103)
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pirates strigifer
Walker, 1873 : 116
. Syntype (s) ( ♀ ): Burma [= Myanmar ]: Moulmein; NHMUK. Synonymized by
Distant (1902: 286)
.

Pirates basiger
Walker, 1873 : 117
. Syntypes ( ♂ , ♀ ): Hongkong and Hindustan [= India or Myanmar ]; NHMUK. Synonymized

subSubSection.paragraph:
by Distant (1902: 286) . Pharantus (sic) geniculatus (nec Stål): Matsumura (1905: 41) . Misidentification ( Esaki 1926: 167 ).
Sirthenea flavipes var. apicalis : Horváth (1909: 359)
.
Sirthenea bharati Sucheta & Chopra, 1988 : 60
. Holotype ( ♂ ), paratypes ( 7 ♂♂ and 6 ♀♀ ): India : Haryana , Hisar; Haryana

Agricultural University Collection. Syn. nov.
Sirthenea flavipes : Cai & Lu (1990: 87)
Sirthenea flavipes var. apicalis : Cai & Lu (1990: 89)
Sirthenea clavata Miller, 1948 : 444
. Holotype ( ♂ ): Indonesia : Sumatra ;
SMF. Syn. nov.
Sirthenea koreana Lee & Kerzhner (1996: 407)
. Holotype ( ♂ ): South Korea , Kyong-Sangpukto; collection of C.E. Lee , Taegu
.

Paratypes ( 72 ♂♂ and 3 ♀♀ ): South Korea : several localities ( Lee and Kerzhner 1996 ). Syn. nov.
Sirthenea melanota Cai & Lu, 1990 : 92
. Holotype ( ♂ ): China : Shaanxi : Mt. Nanwutai: Chang’an; CAU. Syn. nov.
Sirthenea nigripes Murugan & Livingstone, 1990 : 125
. Holotype ( ♂ ): India : Orissa , Koraput District, Sunabeda; Bharathiar

University, Coimbatore, India . Syn. nov.
Sirthenea flavipes : Chłond (2008a: 385)
.
Sirthenea flavipes : Chłond (2008b: 139)
.
Sirthenea flavipes : Chłond & Bugaj-Nawrocka (2015: 3)
.
Sirthenea flavipes :
Chłond et al . (2017
: 1–15).

MAP 7. Distribution of
Sirthenea flavipes ( Stål, 1855 )
.

Redescription : Color : Body generally yellowish and black or with a reddish pronotum with pale setae ( Figs. 79–81 , 201, 202 ), some specimens distinctly darker (
S. melanota
was described based on such specimens). Head yellow to brown, with dark markings and differences in coloration of ante- and postocular part of head. Maxillary and mandibular plates as well as antennifer black to dark brown (creating a dark band extending to anterior margin of eyes) in lateral part of head (visible also in specimens with darker head). Scape and intercalary segments pale (or scape with darker basal part). Pedicel dark brown (or with slightly paler basal and apical part). Basi- and distiflagellum pale with darker basal and apical parts (unicolorous in male). Labium pale or with darker basal part of first visible labial segment, as well as labrum. Anterior pronotal lobe yellowish to black with concolor or dark sulci. Posterior pronotal lobe same color as anterior pronotal lobe or darket (to black). Scutellum and hemelytron dark brown to black. Hemelytron with pale markings, covered with pale and dark setae. Apical part of membrane pale. Shape and size of yellowish markings of membrane variable ( Figs. 80, 81 , 201, 202 ). Legs pale or middle and hind legs slightly darker with pale and brown setae. Abdomen ventrally bicolorous or black. If abdomen bicolorous first visible segment yellow or yellow with dark markings to almost brown,with a pale band (often strongly reduced) extending to abdominal apex, with lateral parts dark brown to black. Connexiva I to VI pale, with darker posterior part of each segment. Connexivum VII pale. Male and female terminalia pale to black.

Structure : Body size variable (small to large), generally robust. Head with various-sized, rather short setae and 3 pairs of trichobothrial setae. Head, pronotum, and margin of scutellum shining. Anteocular part of head 1.9– 2.3 times (female) and 1.7–2.4 times (male) longer than postocular part. Eyes and ocelli large. Eyes narrower than synthlipsis in dorsal view with distinct S-shape curvature in middle of posterior ridge in lateral view. Apodeme depression and transversal furrow of head shallow. Area from hind margin of ocelli to anterior margin of

flavipes
var.
apicalis

—dorsal habitus.

FIGURES 82–93.
Sirthenea
flavipes
(Stål, 1855)
,: 82—styloids, outer view; 83—gonapophysis of VIII segment, inner view; 84—gonocoxite of VIII segment, inner view; 85—pygophore, dorsal view; 86—left paramere, inner view; 87—left paramere, outer view; 88—right paramere, lateral view; 89—right paramere, outer view; 90—median process of pygophore, lateral view; 91—phallus, right lateral view; 92—phallus, left lateral view; 93—phallus, dorsal view After Chłond et al . (2017), modified.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements (in mm, male in parentheses): Body length: 16.1–23.4 (15.9–21.5); maximum width of abdomen: 3.4–5.5 (3.0–4.4); head length: 3.4–4.9 (3.2–4.5); head width: 1.5–2.4 (1.3–2.5); length of anteocular part: 1.7–2.5 (1.5–2.2); length of postocular part: 0.6–1.3 (0.7–1.3); length of synthlipsis: 0.9–1.2 (0.8–1.1); interocellar distance: 0.4–0.7 (0.4–0.6); length of antennal segments I:II:III:IV: 1.0–1.3 (1.0–1.3): 1.7–2.5 (1.7– 2.6): 1.4–2.0 (1.4–2.0): 1.5–2.2 (1.5–2.2); length of visible labial segments I:II:III: 0.8–1.2 (0.9–1.2): 2.4–3.5 (2.3– 3.7): 1.2–1.9 (1.4–1.9); maximum length of anterior pronotal lobe: 2.4–3.5 (2.4–3.2); maximum length of posterior pronotal lobe: 1.3–1.9 (1.3–1.7); maximum width of anterior pronotal lobe: 3.0–4.3 (2.9–4.1); maximum width of posterior pronotal lobe: 3.3–4.9 (3.5–4.8); length of scutellum: 1.2–2.4 (1.2–2.0); length of hemelytron: 10.2–14.4 (9.8–13.2).

Distribution : Afghanistan , Bangladesh , Cambodia , China , India (including Andaman and Nicobar Islands ), Indonesia , Iran , Japan , North Korea , South Korea , Laos , Malesia , Myanmar , Nepal , Pakistan , Philippines , Sri Lanka , Thailand , Vietnam (Map 7).
The wide range of distribution of this species covers two zoogeographical regions: Oriental and Palearctic.

Comments : The type material of two species described from India ,
S. bharati Sucheta & Chopra, 1988
, and
S. nigripes Murugan & Livingstone, 1990
, were unavailable for study. Nevrtheless, the drawings of the type specimens, including their genitalia, presented in the original descriptions ( Sucheta & Chopra 1988 ; Murugan & Livingstone 1990 ) exhibit the same morphological characters as
S. flavipes (
Chłond et al . 2017
)
. Moreover in both papers the main diagnostic characters between the newly described species and
S. flavipes
were color characters.
S. flavipes
has a very wide range of distribution in South and Southeast Asia and the color characters used in differential diagnosis in both mentioned descriptions, have been described as characters of various color forms of specimens within the two populations of
S. flavipes (
Chłond et al . 2017
)
. Type material of
Sirthenea koreana Kerzhner & Lee, 1996
, was also unavailable for study, however the original description containing the drawings of male genital structures as well as possibility of study of the morphological characters and genitalic structures of 3 male specimens of this species, clearly shows that it is conspecific with
S. flavipes
. The type specimen of
S. clavata
has morphological characters (as well as coloration) of specimens belonging to the eastern population of this species (
Chłond et al . 2017
) and shares the same genitalic characters. The only difference between the type specimen of
S. clavata
described by Miller (1948) and other representatives of this species is body size (
S. clavata
is distinctly smaller). The mitochondrial genome of this species was studied by
Gao et al . (2013)
.
